title: Dance in bivouac - Madrid, Spain 1896 - [ 60 FPS - Color - 4K ] - Old footage restoration with AI
description:
This is the army of the Queen of Spain dancing Jota.
It is unclear why they stop at some point, then continue. Perhaps Lumiere wanted to confuse audience on purpose, to create more emotions.

Wikipedia:
🔗 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jota_(music)

Original video was processed with Deep Learning algorithms to achieve modern look and quality. Here is the process:

1. Footage stabilization and noise/dust/scratches removal with After Effects and Neat Video ✔️
🔗 https://www.neatvideo.com/?linkID=p7845
2. Restoration with DeepRemaster, removing scratches and film damage ✔️
🔗 https://github.com/satoshiiizuka/siggraphasia2019_remastering
3. Frame interpolation to get smooth look using DAIN method. Result is 60 FPS video ✔️
🔗 https://github.com/baowenbo/DAIN
4. Colorization using DeOldify with NoGAN. Colors are not accurate, only for ambient mood ✔️
🔗 https://github.com/jantic/DeOldify
5. Upscaling using Topaz Video Enhance AI, upscale preserving detail and reducing noise ✔️
🔗 https://topazlabs.com/video-enhance-ai/ref/755/
⭐⭐⭐ 15% DISCOUNT CODE: oldendays15
6. Automation with Python scripts and AWS Thinkbox Deadline as queue manager ✔️
🔗 https://www.awsthinkbox.com/deadline
7. RTX 2070 Super 8GB, 32GB RAM, Ryzen 9 3900X 12-core. Approx 48hrs/10min video processing.

🎵 Intro Music:
Timelapse by boomopera
https://1.envato.market/om6ao

title: Geneva like never seen before - [ 60 FPS - Color - 4K ] - Old footage restoration with AI
description:

title: Busy street in Marseille - La Canebière - [ 60 FPS - Color - 4K ] - Old footage restoration with AI
description:
Filmed by Louis Lumiere at La Canebière street in Marseille, France.

We can see sardine sellers, American bar, trams and crowd walking by. This movie has a great value for the people of Marseille. Lumiere immortalizes city in 1896 for future generations. Thank you!

About a kilometre long, it runs from the Old Port of Marseille to the Réformés quarter. It has been called the Champs-Élysées of Marseille.

Wikipedia:
🔗 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canebi%C3%A8re

title: Chilling on the beach in year 1900 - [ 60 FPS - Color - 4K ] - Old footage restoration with AI
description:
Filmed by Félix Mesguich in 1900 at the Biarritz Grande Plage, the jewel of Atlantic Pyrenees.
In the background on the right, the Palais Biarritz (former villa Eugénie), and on the left, the Saint-Martin lighthouse.

Few years later famous French photographer, Jacques-Henri Lartique takes one of his first photographs at the same beach. Please take a look at them here, incredible shots!
🔗 https://www.google.com/search?q=lartigue+henri+biarritz&sxsrf=ALeKk00axwj74mv31Vc4Z14_hftHL86ycw:1603894296090&source=lnms&tbm=isch
